What an amazing story! 22 people die every day waiting for a transplant. More than 120,000 people are waiting for a transplant in the U.S. A person is added to the waitlist every 10 minutes. One donor can save 8 lives, and improve 50+. DonaeLifeWisconsin.org

This is the era of Internet. Everything you post online will no longer be """"privately"""" yours anymore, that's the harsh truth. The other day, I read news about Taiwanese woman who claimed her life and career are ruined from one picture that is circulated as a meme. I bet more will come forward to claim that their lives have been negatively affected by the multiplication of digital content that has them in it.
